ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So leave them in their glut of ignorance for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So leave them to their ignorance for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So leave them immersed in their heedlessness till an appointed time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), leave them alone in their dark ignorance for an appointed time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So leave them in their intoxication till a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, leave them in their error for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore leave them in their overwhelming ignorance till
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So leave thou them in their perplexity for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So leave them in their error till a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So leave them in their bewilderment for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wherefore leave thou them in their bewilderment for a season.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So leave them in their stupor for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But leave them in their confused ignorance for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So leave them in their error for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Leave them in their perplexity for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So leave them in their bewilderment until a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:54] So leave them, the disbelievers of Mecca, in their error, their misguidance, for a while, until they die.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So leave them) Muhammad (in their error) in their ignorance (till a time) until the advent of punishment on the Day of Badr.
